title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributing to hitop
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to hitop
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("jmgirard/hitop", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to hitop
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Scoring the B-HiTOP
text: turn item-level ratings mean scores 7 scales, can use score_bhitop() function. needs know object contains data columns contain item-level data. several ways can specify items. First, can provide column numbers use : shortcut. tibble, items column 3 column 47 can use items = 3:47. going also set append = FALSE can quickly see scale scores.
code: scores <- score_bhitop(   data = ku_bhitop,   items = 3:47,   append = FALSE ) scores #> # A tibble: 143 × 7 #>    bhitop_somatoform bhitop_antagonism bhitop_internalizing bhitop_disinhibition #>                <dbl>             <dbl>                <dbl>                <dbl> #>  1              1.12              1.33                 1.43                 1.22 #>  2              1.12              1                    1.43                 1.67 #>  3              1.62              1.33                 2                    1.11 #>  4              1.5               1.56                 2.57                 2.11 #>  5              2                 1.56                 1.29                 2.22 #>  6              2.25              1.22                 2.14                 1.33 #>  7              1.5               3.22                 1.86                 2.33 #>  8              1.25              2.11                 1.14                 1.44 #>  9              2.38              1.33                 2.14                 1.89 #> 10              1                 1.11                 1                    1    #> # ℹ 133 more rows #> # ℹ 3 more variables: bhitop_thoughtDisorder <dbl>, bhitop_detachment <dbl>, #> #   bhitop_pFactor <dbl>

title: Scoring the B-HiTOP
text: instead set append = TRUE (left , default), get back ku_bhitop tibble scale scores added end extra columns. Notice now 54 columns instead 47.
code: scores <- score_bhitop(   data = ku_bhitop,   items = 3:47 ) scores #> # A tibble: 143 × 54 #>    participant      biosex bhitop01 bhitop02 bhitop03 bhitop04 bhitop05 bhitop06 #>    <chr>            <fct>     <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #>  1 R_3KOxNF2JCWCT9… female        1        1        2        1        2        1 #>  2 R_1RLNDHA6qwM6v… female        1        1        1        1        2        1 #>  3 R_61bkFQweO6uye… female        2        2        2        1        3        1 #>  4 R_3kO0nXySSg3nW… female        2        1        2        1        4        1 #>  5 R_5yGEvYGy4YqwY… female        1        2        3        1        2        2 #>  6 R_3Pv6gPT8dxYkB… female        2        3        3        1        3        1 #>  7 R_3KBAdhGCugaGG… female        2        1        2        3        2        3 #>  8 R_5fkRaVh1ZiNvm… male          1        1        1        1        1        1 #>  9 R_5hbvtJ91lzoGS… male          2        2        3        1        2        2 #> 10 R_5dWEI8k79ahEZ… female        1        1        1        1        1        1 #> # ℹ 133 more rows #> # ℹ 46 more variables: bhitop07 <dbl>, bhitop08 <dbl>, bhitop09 <dbl>, #> #   bhitop10 <dbl>, bhitop11 <dbl>, bhitop12 <dbl>, bhitop13 <dbl>, #> #   bhitop14 <dbl>, bhitop15 <dbl>, bhitop16 <dbl>, bhitop17 <dbl>, #> #   bhitop18 <dbl>, bhitop19 <dbl>, bhitop20 <dbl>, bhitop21 <dbl>, #> #   bhitop22 <dbl>, bhitop23 <dbl>, bhitop24 <dbl>, bhitop25 <dbl>, #> #   bhitop26 <dbl>, bhitop27 <dbl>, bhitop28 <dbl>, bhitop29 <dbl>, …

title: Scoring the B-HiTOP
text: Alternatively, provide item column names character string. Typing 45 item names hassle, luckily dataset named consistently can build names automatically using sprintf(). use “bhitop%02d” format apply across numbers 1 45, create zero-padded column names need. zero-padding, just used “bhitop%d”.
code: scores <- score_bhitop(   data = ku_bhitop,   items = sprintf("bhitop%02d", 1:45),   append = FALSE ) scores #> # A tibble: 143 × 7 #>    bhitop_somatoform bhitop_antagonism bhitop_internalizing bhitop_disinhibition #>                <dbl>             <dbl>                <dbl>                <dbl> #>  1              1.12              1.33                 1.43                 1.22 #>  2              1.12              1                    1.43                 1.67 #>  3              1.62              1.33                 2                    1.11 #>  4              1.5               1.56                 2.57                 2.11 #>  5              2                 1.56                 1.29                 2.22 #>  6              2.25              1.22                 2.14                 1.33 #>  7              1.5               3.22                 1.86                 2.33 #>  8              1.25              2.11                 1.14                 1.44 #>  9              2.38              1.33                 2.14                 1.89 #> 10              1                 1.11                 1                    1    #> # ℹ 133 more rows #> # ℹ 3 more variables: bhitop_thoughtDisorder <dbl>, bhitop_detachment <dbl>, #> #   bhitop_pFactor <dbl>

title: Scoring the B-HiTOP
text: Also note scale column prefix “bhitop_” name. can change prefix (e.g., setting "bh_") even turn (e.g., setting "") using prefix argument.
code: scores <- score_bhitop(   data = ku_bhitop,   items = sprintf("bhitop%02d", 1:45),   prefix = "bh_",   append = FALSE ) scores #> # A tibble: 143 × 7 #>    bh_somatoform bh_antagonism bh_internalizing bh_disinhibition #>            <dbl>         <dbl>            <dbl>            <dbl> #>  1          1.12          1.33             1.43             1.22 #>  2          1.12          1                1.43             1.67 #>  3          1.62          1.33             2                1.11 #>  4          1.5           1.56             2.57             2.11 #>  5          2             1.56             1.29             2.22 #>  6          2.25          1.22             2.14             1.33 #>  7          1.5           3.22             1.86             2.33 #>  8          1.25          2.11             1.14             1.44 #>  9          2.38          1.33             2.14             1.89 #> 10          1             1.11             1                1    #> # ℹ 133 more rows #> # ℹ 3 more variables: bh_thoughtDisorder <dbl>, bh_detachment <dbl>, #> #   bh_pFactor <dbl>

title: Scoring the B-HiTOP
text: Finally, addition calculating scale score mean corresponding items, can also calculate scale score’s standard error SD corresponding items divided square root number items. standard errors especially useful plotting scores can converted confidence intervals. turn using calc_se. Note now 14 columns instead 7. extra columns aren’t shown preview , named _se suffix, e.g., bhitop_somatoform_se.

title: Scoring the PID-5

First, can provide column numbers use : shortcut. tibble, items column 1 column 220 can use items = 1:220. going also set append = FALSE can quickly see scale scores. also can set version "FULL" (leave argument , default, shown example example) let know using full 220-item version. instead set append = TRUE (left , default), get back sim_pid5 tibble scale scores added end extra columns. Notice now 245 columns instead 220 25. Alternatively, provide item column names character string. Typing 220 item names hassle, luckily data named consistently can build names automatically using sprintf(). use “pid_%d” format apply across numbers 1 220, create column names need. useful arguments function can read using documentation typing following R console: ?score_pid5 package website.

title: Score the Personality Inventory for DSM-5 Validity Scales — validity_pid5
text: full PID-5, score 17 higher INC indicative inconsistent responding. score 3 higher ORS indicative overreporting. score 10 lower PRD indicative positive impression management (underreporting rather genuine responding) whereas score 21 higher PRD indicative genuine responding (rather positive impression management). score 11 lower SD-TD indicative social desirability (rather defensiveness), whereas score 19 higher SD-TD indicative defensiveness (rather social desirability). PID-5-FSF, scores 8 INC-S indicative inconsistent responding. Cut-scores ORS-S, PRD-S, SD-TD-S yet validated.
